overview: I Lombardi alla prima crociata (The Lombards on the First Crusade) was Verdiâ€™s fourth opera and received its first performance at La Scala, Milan, in February 1843. The grandiloquent subject matter is fleshed-out with broad-brushed musical and dramatic effects and lavish choral scenes created a correspondingly impressive impact. A great success in Milan, it spread to the rest of Europe within a matter of only a few years.
title: I Lombardi alla prima crociata
